title: 820-02020 liquid damage
message:
This arrived with liquid damage and no power. After cleaning up and replacing bad caps and resistors board is back to 20v and partially booting but no there is no image on internal or external.

When external plugged in with internal lcd disconnected the caps lock light comes on. Heatsink is not getting warm.

LPD_INT_HPD is present 1.8V

What should be checked next???

title: 820-02020 liquid damage
message:
So Caps Lock light reacts normally, or just stays on?

Did you note liquid signs on video, or backlight areas?

title: 820-02020 liquid damage
message:
Caps Lock light reacts normally, has the ability to turn on and off.

Yes there was liquid in backlight area. Already replaced backlight driver but there was no change.

title: 820-02020 liquid damage
message:
If LPDP_INT_HPD stays high, internal LCD is detected.
However, missing internal and external video points to CPU problem.

No USB activity, nor Caps Lock light reaction, when internal LCD is connected?

title: 820-02020 liquid damage
message: Have not checked USB activity but Caps lock light reaction is the same when internal LCD or only external  is connected

title: 820-02020 liquid damage
message:
"When external plugged in with internal lcd disconnected the caps lock light comes on."
I was thinking may have a problem when internal LCD is connected.

Check diode mode to ground at LPDP_INT lines; on the M1 side of series capacitors.

title: 820-02020 liquid damage
message: CP614-CP619 all measure .310 diode mode to ground

title: 820-02020 liquid damage
message:
You have 10 caps there; don't forget CP620/21.
Need to check the value on the left side, toward M1 chip.

title: 820-02020 liquid damage
message:
Checked the remaining values and all look good. Looking closer at internal lcd I do see a apple logo for the first few seconds after plugging in.

PPVOUT_LCDBKLT 0V not shorted

LP800 pin 5 only 0.628v  pin 17 1.8v

QP800 pin 2 0.060v pin 4 12.60v

title: 820-02020 liquid damage
message:
"LP800 pin 5 only 0.628v  pin 17 1.8v"
Did you mean [B][U]UP800[/U][/B] missing 5V at pin 5?
Check diode mode to ground there and replace RP844.

title: 820-02020 liquid damage
message:
yes and diode mode to ground  0.250

RP844 replaced but still only 0.628v

title: 820-02020 liquid damage
message:
If you have image, PP5V_S2 must be there; broken trace?
UP800 pin 1 has 0V too?
